0: Image copyright AFP Image caption The letter was written when the budding poet had money problems NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A letter by the French 19th-Century poet Charles Baudelaire announcing he would kill himself has sold at auction for €234,000 (£204,000; $267,000). NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The note, dated 30 June 1845, was addressed to Baudelaire's lover Jeanne Duval. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The poet, who was 24 years old at the time, attempted to commit suicide on the same day - but survived. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The French auction website Osenat said the letter sold to a private buyer for three times the estimated price. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In the letter, Baudelaire informed his mistress of his intention to take his own life. "By the time you receive this letter, I will be dead," it said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I am killing myself because I can no longer live, or bear the burden of falling asleep and waking up again." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Image copyright AFP Image caption Baudelaire is regarded as one of the greatest French poets of all time NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Baudelaire, who had money problems after squandering his inheritance, stabbed himself in the chest but suffered no serious injuries. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He lived for another 22
